channel.title: BBC News - Entertainment & Arts

item.title: Brian Travers: UB40 saxophonist and songwriter dies at 62
item.description: The musician and songwriter was a founding member of the chart-topping reggae band.

item.title: John Lydon loses court battle to stop Sex Pistols songs being used in a new TV series
item.description: The band's former frontman had objected to songs being used in a new Danny Boyle-directed TV drama.

item.title: Gogglebox viewers mourn Mary Cook
item.description: She was known for her appearances on the Channel 4 show with friend Marina Wingrove.

item.title: 'Toby will be a better person after Love Island'
item.description: Lewis Preston runs the finalist's social media accounts and thinks he'll cope with any negativity.

item.title: Joséphine Baker to enter France's Panthéon
item.description: Performer and World War Two resistance fighter Joséphine Baker will be honoured at the mausoleum.

item.title: Everly Brothers: US rock 'n' roll star Don Everly dies aged 84
item.description: The rock 'n' roll duo were known for their harmonies and influenced bands including The Beatles.

item.title: Barakat: First South African film in Cape Town's Afrikaans dialect
item.description: Barakat, or blessing, is the first film in Afrikaaps - a dialect of Afrikaans spoken in Cape Town.

item.title: The Last Bus: Timothy Spall film gives teen busker big break
item.description: Caitlin Agnew was just 16 when two of her songs were picked to feature on the soundtrack for The Last Bus.

item.title: R. Kelly aide says he paid bribe for singer to marry Aaliyah
item.description: An ex-tour manager for the singer testifies that he obtained a fake ID for then 15-year-old Aaliyah.

item.title: Jill Murphy: The Worst Witch and Large family author dies at 72
item.description: The children's writer and illustrator also published picture books like the Large family series.

item.title: Love Island: Is the dating show's honeymoon phase over?
item.description: The ITV show sparked record complaints, so as the latest series ends, is the magic starting to fade?

item.title: Clive Myrie: Becoming host of Mastermind is a big, big job
item.description: The journalist may be feeling jittery about his new role but hopes it will reveal his lighter side.

item.title: Cinema box office takings at 50% of pre-pandemic levels
item.description: Box office takings in the past month are half of their pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Aaliyah albums streaming: 'Her influence is absolutely everywhere'
item.description: Her second album, One In A Million, is streaming for the first time, 20 years after her death.

item.title: Woke: Compliment or criticism, it is now fuelling the culture wars
item.description: The surprising history of a term increasingly thrown around in UK political debate.

item.title: Changing Rooms: Makeover TV show is back - what did critics think?
item.description: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and his leather trousers usher the home makeover show back after 17 years.

item.title: Censor: Video nasty film explores the power of horror
item.description: The film Censor, set during the 80s, delves into impact of the lurid horror movies from that era.

item.title: Nubya Garcia: The British sax star who is jazzing up the BBC Proms
item.description: Saxophonist Nubya Garcia on playing Royal Albert Hall, the Mercury Prize and "natural vibrations".

item.title: Green Man: Festival returns in the Welsh mountains after Covid restrictions
item.description: Wales' largest music festival, Green Man, returns with 25,000 people in attendance.

item.title: The West End star who worked as carer during lockdown
item.description: As theatres reopen, actors like Stephen Beckett have been swapping their lockdown jobs for their place on the stage once more.

item.title: You may go to the ball: Cinderella opens in the West End
item.description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Emerald Fennel’s reimagining of the classic fairytale debuts in London.

item.title: Ryan Reynolds: Video games and the making of Free Guy
item.description: Actor and producer Ryan Reynolds on preparing to play a character caught up in a multiplayer game.

item.title: Drag Race UK queens: Covid 'pushed us creatively'
item.description: Newsbeat has spoken to all 12 queens taking part in the new series.

item.title: Bill Bailey pays tribute to ‘dearest friend’ Sean Lock
item.description: The comedian remembers Sean Lock, who has died from cancer at the age of 58.
